channel.title: Web3 Meta-Crisis Wiki
channel.description: Last 10 notes on Web3 Meta-Crisis Wiki

item.title: Call_Transcript
item.description: 0:01 - Kevin Owocki Are you working outside also? 0:03 - Benjamin Life No. OK. 0:04 - Unidentified Speaker He believed it, though.

item.title: Auditability
item.description: Auditability Definition Auditability is the capacity of blockchain systems to provide transparent, verifiable, and publicly accessible records of all transactions, operations, and decisions.

item.title: Automation
item.description: Automation Definition Automation is the capacity of blockchain systems to execute predefined actions automatically without human intervention, using smart contracts and other automated mechanisms.

item.title: Borderlessness
item.description: Borderlessness Definition Borderlessness is the capacity of blockchain systems to operate across geographical, political, and jurisdictional boundaries without requiring permission or approval from any central authority.

item.title: Censorship_Resistance
item.description: Censorship Resistance Definition Censorship resistance is the capacity of a system to continue functioning and providing access to information, services, or resources even when powerful entities attempt to block, restrict, or control access.

item.title: Distributed_Consensus
item.description: Distributed Consensus Definition Distributed consensus is the process by which multiple nodes in a decentralized network agree on the state of a shared system without relying on a central authority.

item.title: Immutability
item.description: Immutability Definition Immutability in blockchain systems refers to the property that once data is recorded on a blockchain, it cannot be altered or deleted without consensus from the network.

item.title: Permissionlessness
item.description: Permissionlessness Definition Permissionlessness is the capacity of blockchain systems to allow anyone to participate without requiring approval from central authorities or intermediaries.

item.title: Portability
item.description: Portability Definition Portability is the capacity of blockchain systems to enable users to move their assets, data, and identity across different platforms, networks, and applications without losing ownership or functionality.
